Reviews.Title: “Handy location but that was the only good thing about it.”
Reviews.Author: LMW31
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights to attend 3 day event at Sydney Entertainment Centre.All the hotels increase their prices as it is an annual event. Booked a Family Room. Room was smaller than most regular hotel rooms it contained double and single bed. Room looked as though it needed refirbishment. Advertised as having bath but was not full size. Toilet roll holder not fitted to wall properly. Staff were not overly friendly or helpful and buffet breakfast only had minimal amount of choice and very slow to replenish. $2 per item if you need to store luggage

Reviews.Title: “the only thing good about it is the location”
Reviews.Author: cyciliayu
Reviews.Content: tiny room, dirty carpet, old furniture, not cozy at all. I asked for a quiet room as i have read some review saying it can get quite noisy at night, and don't expect to sleep until 2am. turned out the quieter side is quiet, but because it's facing the exhaust vent of the kitchen, you don't get fresh smell air. the staff are not very warm. they don't greet you when you come back or go out. they didn't inform me the extra charge when I gave them my credit card. when i read it on the form he asked me to sign, my card was already charged. :( the only thing good about this hotel is it's location. it's close to Chinatown, close to food court, restaurants, Darling harbor, supermarket, bus stops, light rail, mono rail, and central station. the internet is not free, 50C per minute, or $20 a day. i brought my own pocket wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby & lacking customer service”
Reviews.Author: queenotisblue
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in early February. The only positive thing I have to say about the Capital Square Hotel is that its location is good. Other than that there really isn't much to recommend it. The hotel is shabby and run-down. There seems no obvious attempt by the owners/management to undertake regular maintenance that would make it a pleasant budget-priced hotel to stay in. We stayed here four to five years ago and the overall condition of the hotel has deteriorated. Housekeeping is sub-standard. We were supplied with dirty towels, and our rooms weren't cleaned properly - we found items from the previous occupants on the floor of our room. One day we came back to our room late in the afternoon & it wasn't made up. When I complained about this I was told that the rooms of guests already checked into the hotel weren't cleaned until after 2pm. While I understand there is a focus on readying rooms for incoming guests, I've never come back to a room after 4pm, while staying at other hotels, to find it unmade. The reception staff are either not trained or under-trained and treat hotel guests with disdain & disrespect. I was lied to on several occasions by the reception staff in relation to room-related issues requiring attention - including what was being done to address the issues & the whereabouts of the manager. We had to move rooms twice due in response to problems with them. The first room we were checked into was full of mosquitoes, the second room we were placed in was on George Street and extremely noisy. While we were offered a discount on one nights stay, even this was problematic as the staff member didn't apply it correctly the first time, another refund had to be issued and the discount applied again. Even on leaving, the lack of care about customer service and experience was apparent. We asked to check our bags at reception while we collected our rental car, a short 15 min walk away. We were told it would cost $2.00 per bag. Overall, it was not a pleasant stay and we were glad to leave. As I said earlier, staying in budget accommodation doesn't have to be a disappointing experience. However, staying at Capital Square Hotel was. We won't be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for a one-night stay”
Reviews.Author: Ladia2287
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night in December and whilst I wouldn't recommend it for more than a night or two, it is very good value if all you want is a bed to sleep in. No room service or in-room food preparation facilities, and the restaurant only being open for breakfast means that you are fending for yourself for most meals but there are some very good choices to dine out in easy walking distance, and the monorail is only one street away if you want to venture out but don't want sore feet when you get back. Had an issue with my key when I first arrived (it wouldn't unlock the door) but the staff were more than happy to help. All in all, a reasonable quality stay at a reasonable budget.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price, great location.”
Reviews.Author: denjam46
Reviews.Content: We spent a couple of nights mid week at this hotel. Averaged $150 a night including a good full breakfast buffet. This hotel is getting a little threadbare,although beds and bathrooms were good.( only push button soap and shampoo etc.) Other reviews said hotel was dirty, we didn't find this at all.Rooms are small but this is a budget hotel..dont lose sight of this point.The location is the star in this hotels heaven. 1 minute to the markets, chinatown, tram service to casino, and transport to all of Sydney basically at the door (well 50 metres across the road). This hotel is a place to sleep and have some breakfast ..it isnt a resort..there are no balconies or great views.Its clean and well located..come and enjoy Sydney at a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby and small ... but good for Chinatown”
Reviews.Author: ZeddyDog
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was a shabby (don't look down at the carpet) and super small, making bathing a whole new experience. The Internet was only available for fee at fixed stations, and parking was $30 per day. On the plus side, the breakfast was cooked (okay) and varied, in a pleasant enough cafe. The location is fantastic for Chinatown (alive at night) and in a visible/safe spot. I think I expected better being Rydges, but if location is more important than comfort, its fine for 1 person for a night or two (no more).

Reviews.Title: “Find another hotel”
Reviews.Author: joseph t
Reviews.Content: I don't know if they're trying the old "colonial" feel and atmosphere but it's not working. The facade looks nice, that's it. The rooms look old but not the good "old", it looks unkept and dirty. And it's really small. There were three of us in the room and it is cramped we could barely walk around. The carpets were torn and disgusting. The bathrooms were really bad to say the least. To sum it up, I didn't take a bath for 3 days because of this (its a secret I never tell anybody), I just shampoo'd my hair. Hot shower doesn't work, or is really hard to make it work. Nothing in this hotel is worth complimenting. They claim it's a budget hotel, but it's not really cheap. To be fair, we stayed here on Dec 29 to Jan 1, New Years in Sydney so all the hotels here were fully booked. I'm sure this hotel jacked up their rates for this peak season I dont know how much they charge in off peak. The only good thing I remember in this hotel is the French lady receptionist. She is one of the friendliest and most helpful staff I have encountered. She's really very nice and accommodating. The other staff were complete opposite. They were unfriendly, uninviting, rude, and cold. Overall, I don't think I'll stay here again. Just find another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location to see the Show”
Reviews.Author: JonBrisbane
Reviews.Content: Location of this hotel was great, central to most things Sydney, especially Capitol Theatre is just next door. The room we had was small but sufficient and clean with small lobby at the main entrance, staff was friendly. Breakfast was average, coffee was awful. The building is a liitle aged needing some attentions. The price we paid was OK, but wasn't cheap. Not quite the usual standard of the Rydges Brand. The window was sound proof, but the walls weren't as every time some shut the door, there was a loud bang!

Reviews.Title: “Run Down”
Reviews.Author: monika40Fremantle
Reviews.Content: We were totally disappointed at our stay. The location is excellent but....................... The rooms are small and, lacking any shelf or hanging space for clothes, we were obliged to live out of our suitcases for the three nights we were in Sydney - and there was only floor space for one case, so we had to shuffle those on and off the bed to access them. The carpets were stained, the hallways were dingy

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Sean E
Reviews.Content: For the price this place is terrible, I was tricked by the "Rydges" branding on the website. I was overseas when I booked, only to fly back and find a small dirty room with stains on the carpet and hairs on the floor in the bathroom - they even call it the "deluxe queen". Note to self, read the below messages (all are spot on to the experience I had) before booking next time!

Reviews.Title: “Very well located - and decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Matthew N
Reviews.Content: We found capitol square hotel location is so so excellent. It is next to china town and paddy market - these are the two places in sydney that you can find food and goods at a very reasonable prices. The hotel is clean enough (do not compare with likes of Novotel) and comfortable enough for our stay and the budget. You can actually talked to the manager and get the price reduced if you ask. The breakfast is good - but with so many eating places nearby and supermarket around - you can save some money by taking the deal without breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “WILL NEVER STAY AGAIN!”
Reviews.Author: Tarnz
Reviews.Content: Sleazy dirty hotel that needs to be shut down & complete overhaul done! As per other reviews, small dirty rooms, strange smells in hallways & we even had drug dealers in the room next to us on the last night! We stayed for 1 night on our arrival & 2 nights at the end of our trip....ended up staying at the Radisson, Liverpool St, for 2 nights for the same price with far superior rooms! The major problem with Rydges group of hotels is that there is no-one to complain to as they have no 'head office' as such ??? Indiviually owned I think. No way would we stay at ANY Rydges hotel again as we gave a bacd review for the one in Wellington too...not quite as bad but all seem to have small dirty rooms. We had our 2 teenage sons with us & I was quite worried that they were in a separate room as we got NO sleep at all on the last night with people coming & going, doors slamming, 'code knocks' going on in the next room.....got woken with a call at 7.50 saying 'a lady' was coming up to see us..strange as we know no-one local in Sydney, but they still allowed her into the building. This person knocked on our door looking very strung out on drugs and left...got another call telling us to not open our door as this 'lady' had run into the lift without permission & was wondering our floor - no security present or called at all!!! Great location but VERY VERY dodgy!!! Oh & service was terrible, virtually got keys chucked at us the first night, however the receptionist on our last night was lovely. DO NOT STAY HERE AT ALL!!!!

Reviews.Title: “OK for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: fluffy63
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Capitol for one night prior to a two day sampler cruise. The hotel is in a good location, close to Chinatown, where we dined. We did pay $269 for the night which was overpriced for the quality of the room, however, it was a last minute deal and there was nothing else available (many hotels were booked out) so we chose to stay here. The reception staff were friendly enough and having a balcony was nice as we looked across George Street. The room was spacious although the decor was looking old. The bathroom was a reasonable size and the firmness of the bed and the location of the room made for a peaceful night's sleep. Would I stay here again? Yes! If the price were more reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay here”
Reviews.Author: K1w1Melbourne
Reviews.Content: I recently booked this hotel last minute for a collegue who was staying here for 18 days. I miss calculated the days and was short one day called them back and even after spending over $3000 with them they wanted to charge me an extra $250 just for the one night. Normal day rate was $160.... Staff are terrible and i dont believe they understand Customer Service but im guess this comes from Management down as well.

Reviews.Title: “Do not, I repeat, DO NOT stay here”
Reviews.Author: SeanC67
Reviews.Content: Had to go to Sydney on business. Usually they put staff up at another hotel in the CBD. However they were full. This place seemed like a good option because it was very close. And cheap. I knew something was up when, upon checking in, I walked into the lift and was ovewhelmed with the smell of body odour. Nasty. And then I got to my room. You can see the photos. They speak for themselves. The room was unclean and tired, the carpets stained, the walls scuffed, the mini bar was not stocked, and because it had been shut up all day with the curtains open and the sun streaming into the room it was like a sauna when I walked in. I stayed under sufferage simply because it had been a long day, and any bed was welcome. I would not have been surprised to see cockroaches scuttling under the bed when I awoke in the morning. The staff were OK, but they rang me two days earlier to ask why i had been a no show the night before. Seems someone at the desk got the dates mixed when they did the booking. It has one thing going for it - location. It is very close to Sydney's Chinatown, Darling Harbour, and Hyde Park. The whole place needs revovating. Or at the very a least a freshening. Then it might be worth the rates they charge.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for a show”
Reviews.Author: Bad_Seed4
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here a few times before and this was the least successful stay. This is the best hotel to stay in if you are going to a show at the Capitol Theatre as it is next door and that is why we chose it. There is a parking garage next door at typical Sydney rates for those with a car. Because I had some trouple making an online booking (could not get the system to undestand I needed a room for 4 with breakfast, the lady who responded to my email offered to include breakfast and my extra bed at no extra charge. When I checked in, I was charged for the extra bed. I had to produce the original email before the charge was reversed (with somewhat poor grace by the front desk). The room was big enough (ie not very) but I knew and expected that and was adequate for our needs. Breakfast was fine as well. This time around, we had a room fronting George Street on a lower floor and it was very noisy so next time I would ask for a room on Campbell St on a higher floor, The other negative was the fire alarm went off just before midnight and there were all these guests lining the corridors with bewildered looks on their faces wondering what to do. The alarm went for about 1 minute then stopped. No sign of a staff member anywhere so everyone went back to bed assuming it was a false alarm but no explanation or apology the next day so all in all, not the best stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good service...but....”
Reviews.Author: Freshjive_Adelaide
Reviews.Content: It's a great location less than 5 minutes walk from Central Station and right beside the Capitol Theatre. The staff were efficient and friendly. Breakfast was ok. However, it does need some modernising. The beds were very hard to sleep in, the pillows were not even pillows, the room I stayed in had a fold out bed? It would be a great hotel if they could address the beds and make the decor more up to date, it just yells out 80s, it doesnt need to be flash, just keep it nice and simple.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: milly99
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel. I found the staff to be very friendly - both at reception and in the dining room for breakfast. The room is pretty basic and dated but we were happy enough. We loved the way the windows opened onto George St and the kids could 'people-watch'! The towels and bed covers are a bit 'cheapy' but the sheets were crisp and clean. A few extra pillows would have been nice. The location was fantastic for after the theatre and the next morning we could pop over the Paddy's Market while reception watched our bags. All in all, I would stay again but don't expect 5star.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I've stayed at, backpackers better option”
Reviews.Author: BusyTravellerX
Reviews.Content: Avoid this place, although great location... Smells funny, rooms are shabby. Beds sag. Bed spreads and carpet have odd stains. Everything feels grimy.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel refurbishment looking good. Have stayed a couple of times,always good. Excellent service and Great Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: kalyngra
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this Hotel several times now. The staff are always obliging in providing the inside courtyard rooms. The restaurant level refurbishment has greatly added to the warmth of the Hotel. As always the breakfasts are excellent value and quality. This is really a great location. Particularly now as we choose to travel from the North Coast on the XPT train. Central railway is within walking distance of the Hotel, however, we have now discovered the Sydney light rail which goes directly to the rear entrance of this Hotel at minimal cost. Tips for Seniors. To ride the Light Rail you need to buy the $2.50 State Rail or Ferry pass and the Light Rail conductors will honour the daily pass. The light rail also goes to Star city. If you go to the Sports Area Theatre at Star City large variety of great meals around $12.00. They also have a seafood buffet upstairs for around $35.00. This hotel is next to the Capitol Theatre which has most of the top live theatre in Sydney.We stayed overnight to meet up with the Sun Princess which was leaving on our cruise from Barangaroo. The terminal is about a 20 minute walk which is mostly level and should not be a problem for most people. Certainly will return when needing to stay in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “AIGHT”
Reviews.Author: Corleone37
Reviews.Content: This place was in a nice location in China Town and near darling harbor. The room was nice and cozy old school style ! kind of God Father era feel. Good for a short stay and mad price :-) service was wack tho but over all GOOD. Out of 10 I would probably say 7 and for the price you cant complain PEACE

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Emmajb255115
Reviews.Content: central, interesting area, close to darling harbour and chna town, the rooms were clean, well serviced and had good air conditionng. the double bed sagged a bit in the middle so was fine for a single but not great for a couple. overal a very acceptable hotel the staff were friendly and helpful and i would feel good stayng there again.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD VALUE-YOU GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR”
Reviews.Author: KatePerth
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Capitol Square Hotel for 4 nights. Okay, the rooms & bathroom are tiny, but the room was clean, the bedlinen & towels were clean, the beds comfy & staff friendly. You cannot beat the location, it is excellent. As other reviews say - it is close to Paddy's Market, the 555 Free shuttle leaves from just outside the door, the Catholic Church is over the road, the light rail behind the hotel takes you to Star City or the Fish Markets. China Town is around the corner. There are dozens of pubs and cheap restaurants close by. Sure, it is not the "Ritz", but for what you pay, the hotel is very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible.....”
Reviews.Author: RJ1990
Reviews.Content: Room was very old & dated, smelled musty, carpet dirty, bed spreads not even ironed, bathroom tiny & in need of work, floorboards creaked badly, I just wanted to spray "Glen 20" over everything, picked this hotel as was seeing Mary Poppins, show was cancelled due to problems, so checked out at 9.30pm couldn't wait to leave, NEVER staying here again....

Reviews.Title: “Disapointment +++”
Reviews.Author: Kel69g
Reviews.Content: The first thing I have to say is the location is great. It's central, close to Paddy's markets, Chinatown and the Capital Theatre, which is why we picked this Hotel. Would I stay there again, single word answer NO. When we opened the door the first thing you were hit with was the smell of smoke, obviously this is was a smoking room. The room was very small and dated and could have done with a good clean. The ensuite was very lacking, no plug, two small towels (one each) which were threadbare and in one corner had a whole worn through, and a toilet which continually ran. We slept with the air conditioner on the coldest setting as the room was stuffy, an the only window could be opened but had no gauze or security mesh. The bed was hard and when we turned the bed back found hair in the bed. As part of our deal we had a full buffett breakfast, which while it did not have a large selection, was nice, probably the highlight of our stay here. Would I recommend this Hotel to anyone!!!!!! Not if I liked them.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Exuberant_Traveller
Reviews.Content: This tourist Hotel is in an excelent position. The rooms are clean with a comfortable bed and en suite TV and tea & coffe. The staff were friendly and helpful. This was my second visit and I stayed for 4 nights. Breakfast is optional but if you prebook breakfast it is cheaper. I do not know a better value hotel in Sydney if you are a tourist. However it just offers accomodation but there are a number of good cafes nearby and a Starbucks in the building.

Reviews.Title: “One stay at this hotel, was enough. Wont be back.”
Reviews.Author: KdOz
Reviews.Content: Checked in at around 9.30pm, met by reception staff that clearly had no desire to be there. Given a key to a smoking room when had prior to arrival requested a non smoking room. The rate was in my opinion at $99 per night, overly priced. After moving to a non smoking room, we were met by hairs on the bed, an old fashioned soap dispenser. I beleive in second chances so I tried breakfast at $17 per person, I expected a reasonable selection. There were scrambled eggs, sausages, beans & spaghetti (served with a server with holes in it), a few cereals, a few breads and a few fruits. The food tasted average and given we waited for it to open we would have expected fresher tasing food and maybe a wider selection. Hash browns would be a welcome addition. On departure I made the staff aware of my dissapointment, they didnt seem bothered at all. Also I might add - paying $2 per item to store for the day is insane, especially when it is too much hard work and effort for the staff to give you access. This is usually met by rolling eyes of dissatifaction.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Dreese_Jen
Reviews.Content: This is an okay hotel if size of room isn't important and you don't mind old bathroom facilities. We stayed here based on it being cheap and its located in the heart of Sydney and is walking distance to most cool places. Would happily stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Prime position and value for money”
Reviews.Author: crossbordertraveller
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I were in Sydney to see a live show at the Capitol Theatre over the long weekend. I picked the hotel for it's proximity to the theatre and price. I was not disappointed. This is not a 5star hotel, but it has everything you need without a big price tag. It was clean, with great beds, a generous bathroom and good water pressure in the shower. Staff we dealt with were agreeable, efficient and courteous. It could not have been closer to to theatre and a comfortable walk to the Pitt Street mall for shopping, cinemas are very close. Easy walking distance to restaurants at Cockle Bay and Darling Harbour.

Reviews.Title: “best location for capitol theatre and chinatown”
Reviews.Author: penwar
Reviews.Content: Returned to this hotel for 5th time. If you are going to a show at Capitol Theatre, this is THE BEST location, right next door!! Great restaurants and Irish pub downstairs, even Harrys Cafe de wheels! Some rooms are quite small, but price and location make up for this. Rooms are clean and comfortable. Short walk from Central Station and even shorter walk to George St, and buses to everywhere. Hubbie and I stay here when going overseas night before departure and 5 minute walk to Chinatown and Paddys Markets. Train to airport 5 minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money. Excellent Location. Breakfasts very good. Apparently Undergoing refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: kalyngra
Reviews.Content: We stayed in March prior to Asian and European Holiday. We had an inside room with balcony overlooking the atrium. Nice and quiet. The rooms are spacious although very tired. In April on return we had another 2 nights. After experiencing so called 3 and 4 star hotels in Europe this Hotel wants for nothing. It has good refrigerator, TV, Air Conditioning, Tea and Coffee making facilities. Reasonable views ,the best location in Sydney for access to Rail. Monorail, Light Tram, Ferries, China Town, Darling Harbour. During the latter stay it was apparent that some refurbishment is happening. For $50.00 a night less than equivalent accommodation in Sydney and with such a lovely breakfast and a newspaper We will return whenever in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: mtbeader
Reviews.Content: Where do I start, this hotel was so bad. It was absolutely filthy, you wouldn't dare step on the carpet in bare feet. Mouldy bathroom, dirty windows that didn't open. The air conditioning didn't work and it was in the high 90's and no one seemed to care. The staff was rude. The only thing okay was the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Good price - quality ratio hotel with excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: Koen509
Reviews.Content: I arrived early in the mornig but I still had the possibility to store my luggage for free so that I could discover Sydney. My room was clean and the airconditioning wasn' noisy. I didn't have a great view though but that didn't bodered me. I prefer a quiet room which it absolutly was. Great breakfast every morning and I was always greeted with a big smile, great way to start the day!! But the biggest asset of the hotel is the location!! On a 10 minute walk from Darling Harbour, near China Town, Central Station is only minutes away and there is busstop just around the corner. There is even a Starbucks right next door.

Reviews.Title: “To be avoided”
Reviews.Author: acarb83
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Capitol Square Hotel for one night in February. I chose it because I was travelling alone and wanted to save some money. I paid 109AUD. The hotel is conveniently located on George St not far from the Station. It is a long walk to the main Harbour, but Darling Harbour is pretty close. The building itself is very old but the decor of the hotel is reasonable. However, the room was not good. The room: old smelly carpet, very beige decor, 20-year-old TV, traditional metal keys. Because it is facing George St, it is also quite noisy at any time of day and night. I couldn't even try to open the ultra-dirty windows to get rid of the musty feel. The air-con and beds are OK. The bathroom is also just OK, with a tiny bathtub.

Reviews.Title: “Tired rooms,good location,good service,not a bad price for new year”
Reviews.Author: Welltravelled75
Reviews.Content: Having read previous reviews i was a bit nervous opening the door to our room.The room was small and the carpet was marked & dirty with the furniture old & warn. Checked the bedding straight away but it was fine. Overall it wasn't a bad hotel ,the reception and restaurant were fine & the public areas quite clean & smart.The room was tired & in need of renovating but it had everything we needed (tv,iron,kettle,fridge) and the bathroom was ok.The room we got was actually inside the arcade so we had an enclosed balcony and no noise.The staff on reception were always helpful and the restaurant staff and cleaners were pleasant enough. Overall it was a fair hotel for the price we paid over new year.

Reviews.Title: “Try else where!”
Reviews.Author: Fish096
Reviews.Content: Check in wasn't an issue, location wasn't an issue, Starbucks on the corner is handy, being near the market, Darling Harbour, the free Shuttle bus (555) was all great - but the rooms were not. I have no issue with small rooms, you get what you pay for. I do have an issue with unkept rooms, rooms way past their redecoration date and general unclean rooms. Carpet was sticky to walk on, many many spider webs behind the curtains (not just a small one that could have been over looked), grime around the skirting boards that was awful and cupboard hinge falling off. Sheets looked clean, but was scared to check any closer, in case I found hidden surprises.

Reviews.Title: “Grossed me out”
Reviews.Author: spiegalion
Reviews.Content: I am not easily disgusted, but this hotel grossed me out. Carpet was DISGUSTING - stained and worn out, and my wife and I had trouble falling asleep because the sheets smelled and the blankets felt dingy, like you'd expect to find in an army barracks. Worst of all, the room cost us $129 for the night and I am reasonably certain we could have found similar quality and cleanliness at the nearby backpackers' hostel for $20 bucks.

Reviews.Title: “Very Average”
Reviews.Author: kezza4u
Reviews.Content: Reception was very good and our room was ready early which was a plus. Very good location. The rooms are small, outdated and need renovating. You could hardly see out of the window through the dirt. Paid premium price as was a busy time, definately not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is outdated but good value, great location & Friendly service.”
Reviews.Author: skeeto888
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure why previous writers reviewed this place so negatively!?! I booked 2x family rooms for $636 for 7 adults, you'll be lucky to find something decent and budget like this in sydney, unless you venture out in the burbs or stay at backpacker. Room - I have to agree though the rooms are outdated but its not the worse. I have stayed at worse places in sydney. My room had a double bed & 1 single. The room was clean and decent(though when we first entered, it was abit smelly and stuffy but once you turn on the air con, its fine). The bathroom include shampoo, body wash and hair dryer. The bathroom lacked a ventilation fan which meant, it can get stuffy and hot after someone had a hot shower. I have no complaints about the place especially for the price i was paying for. Location - The hotel centrally located, minutes walk to chinatown, world square and many cafes and restaurants. In fact, this hotel is located right in the heart of the thai precinct, which means you have great (and cheap) thai restaurants right outside your door. Although the hotel is centrally located, it is near the main road so you can hear traffic from the road so if you are someone that needs absolute silence to sleep then you should maybe look elsewhere. Service - very friendly. At first front desk forgot to add an extra bed to one of the rooms but it was quickly rectified when i called them to remind them. On our last day, the guy at the front desk was very helpful by calling the taxi service for us.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible and dirty”
Reviews.Author: tilbake
Reviews.Content: Had to rebook hotel.Could not stay in the room. Could not open the window , and no fresh air from the A/C. Cleanliness was really bad. Black marks on the walls, Could`nt see the street through the windows ( to much poo from birds ), the vacum cleaner could not have been used for weeks around tabels ie. Stay away from this hotel....

Reviews.Title: “Dirtiest Hotel we have ever stayed in poor service”
Reviews.Author: 528950Judy57
Reviews.Content: worst experience we have ever had in Sydney. not only was the room filthy, floor uneven bedcovers old and wrinkled. would not take my shoes off on the dirty carpet. windows dusty and dirty. paintwork cracked. $20 would be the correct price to pay. Car park did not open unitl 815 am. Never again this used to be a ,lovely hotel what happened!!

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here if you are looking for Rydges normal quality”
Reviews.Author: sbricho
Reviews.Content: I have not stayed in worse hotel accommodation in Australia. The room had stains on the carpet, very tired and old furniture and decor, everything was second rate / cheap & nasty. My colleague had a stained sheet which was not changed, no bed spread, TV reception was terrible, bed was way past its prime, the bathroom was too small, required sitting sideways on the toilet. NO recognition of Rydges membership. The website photos and acutal hotel are somewhat apart. Reception could not tell me the best way the SCG (was only 20 mins walk away). Staying here was a BIG mistake and will NEVER happen again.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor looking hotel”
Reviews.Author: RusskieGirl
Reviews.Content: The rooms are old and small. The bathrooms had pink/red mould on the floor edges from not being cleaned properly. The only lift broke down while we were there and the staff had to walk us around the hotel to a side door and walk up flights of stairs each time we wanted to go in or out. The only good thing is the location.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible experience - wouldn't stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Crawley86
Reviews.Content: I decided to stay at this hotel as it came with the Rydges name and there were limited hotels available for under A$200 per night on this particular weekend. I have looked at this hotel before but hadn't stayed there because it was too pricey normally when quality hotels had been cheaper. The room was horribly small and dated. It felt like I was staying in a dirty pub or something. The room was tiny and the bathroom looked like something from the 80s. Then the sole lift broke down and wasnâ€™t fixed in the 2 days I was there. This meant that everyone in the hotel was required to take the fire stairs which happened to deposit us out some random fire exit on George St. To get back in, there was meant to be a security guard or something to let us in, but I never saw them. So every time I wanted to get back up to my room, I had to go to reception for someone to unlock the door. This was made worse when trying to check out and we had to lug a heap of heavy bags down the fire stairs. To make it worse, when checking out, all we got from the receptionist was "Sorry about the lift, it was out of our control" with no type of compensation. This was particularly disappointing considering the excessive price we paid to stay there. Good points? It is in a great location. That is it. Wont be staying there again. So many better hotels in the area for similar prices. Would even be willing to pay more for a little bit of quality.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for budget travelling”
Reviews.Author: DJ_Mizit
Reviews.Content: Booked for 3 night stay from hotel website, was only able to book 2 night stay and then a seperate booking for the 3rd night which included buffet breakfast - not our choice but the website would only allow us to book this combination. Check-in and out was quick and easy, the room is very basic set up which was indicated by the price. Room is small and comfortable for 2 people anymore than this and it would be cramped. The room is clean and towards the end of the building so it was quiet. The location is fantasic for traveller's without a vehicle as everything is close in proximity to this hotel, it's within the CBD. Staff are friendly but possibly need to work on directions, I was asking about a street which was 2 blocks from the hotel and they had no idea where it was and how I could get there - I ended up googling the directions on my phone. Checking in early and storing luggage at reception is no problems or hassles, but was told that if I wanted to store luggage at reception upon checkout there would incurr an additional fee - this is the first I've heard a hotel charging for this type of thing. Buffet breakfast was average, not much selection - but again reflective in the price paid. If I had a choice I wouldn't buy another buffet breakfast package as pre-paid prices are more expensive than if you were to purchase upon arrival (which I found very strange). Being in the prime location and walking distance to so many restaurants, I would have rather spend the extra $20 we did on the buffet to eat at a restaurant in Chinatown. Not sure if it was the buffet breakfast but my husband and I were both sick shortly after having the buffet, which was very unpleasent. All in all this hotel is very basic and good value for the budget traveller - but do stay away from the buffet breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: duffer70
Reviews.Content: For the price I got through an online booking (can't remember which site, but it wasn't wotif) of only a bit over $100/night averaged over 6 nights, this was good value. My wife would say my standards aren't particularly high, but I couldn't fault the cleanliness. There were a few chips off the paint and worn carpets here and there, but I don't rate that sort of thing as an issue. I didn't demand a lot of the staff, but they were always helpful and polite when I did deal with them. The $12 (if you arrange it the night before) hot buffet breakfast is good, if you have the appetite to do it justice, though there were a few bacon rashers that weren't cooked properly because they hadn't been unfolded enough. Room was adequate, with just enough space for all the facilities and not much more. TV reception was OK. Charges for broadband internet access were too steep, though. Some noise leaked through from the street, but generally not enough to disturb sleep (at least at hours you're likely to want to be sleeping). I don't really know why I didn't sleep all that well, as the bed was reasonably comfortable. I heard very little noise from the corridor, and virtually none from adjacent rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location , Average Room”
Reviews.Author: watermelon_23
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel as I was going to a concert at the Sydney Entertainment Centre in Haymarket on the night I was booked and could walk to the concert venue. I was disappointed with the room as I have stayed in a few other Rydges hotels in the past and this hotel definitely isn't up to the Rydges standard. While I realise the Capitol Square is only managed by Rydges I think it is negatively impacting their brand by being associated with this hotel. My main gripe with this hotel was the staff on reception. I had pre-paid for breakfast when I booked and when I arrived at the property I saw that they were offering a cheaper price for breakfast if you paid at check-in. I asked if I could get the cheaper price and was told no I couldn't have it. I think that's a bit much when the price for breakfast is normally more if you pay at the venue rather than pre-book. The room was very average and the bathroom was a bit dirty, and while the location was handy, there are plenty of other hotels in this area and I will give one of those a go before staying at this property again. I got the room through the Rydges website and paid about $140. I have stayed in much better hotels for that price through wotif.com in the past.

Reviews.Title: “Ripped off by the Receptionist - lack of communication.”
Reviews.Author: WatchingYou_10
Reviews.Content: We checked in on the 11th July 2010. Greeted by the Receptionist (very strange). asked for a credit card deposit or $100.00 cash to put on the two rooms for a bond. We were not notified wen booking the hotel, through Bookings.com, so very suprised at the request. We gave credit card, he then charged the whole amount of our stay, and it wasnt until he gave me the recipt, which i thought was for the bond, but instead the idiot had charged the full amount of 2 rooms for three nights. and then asked again for bond money. We actually had the cash, and did not want to use the credit card for our stay.( so had issues with bank transfers etc, because of what he had done and not told us, or gave us a opportunity to pay by cash). The beds have been around for about 20 years, with a big slump..Wen I asked to buy a energy drink (cos I so needed it after dealing with him) he told me that I dont need it, and I should go and buy a Coffee??? I clearly told him that I dont drink Coffee, and to give me the drink! Would not recommend to anyone, as they are very unprofessional, and reali dont care about where they work. Rydges should be ashamed to have the association with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Capitol Square - a bargain hotel !”
Reviews.Author: Tina392009
Reviews.Content: Upon booking we requested for an early check-in and a room with a view and the staff at Capitol Square Hotel attended to both these requests. We found that the room was clean and that it had all the necessary amenities. It was very centrally located to all the attractions and it was very close to the train station and to bus stops. The staff were very friendly and polite. We would definitely stay there again and we have told friends and family about this hidden gem. Compared to lots of other hotels in Sydney, we found that Capitol Square Hotel is a great bargain. If we hadn't organised to stay with family the rest of our trip to Sydney we would have stayed at this hotel the full five days. Thank you for keeping prices low! Tina xxxx P.S. Just the bed was a little too springy......

Reviews.Title: “a close place to all sydney”
Reviews.Author: shifty101
Reviews.Content: i stayed here for two nights and it was very nice. close to theater (right next door) close to tram, buses, nightlife the works. the room was clean, basic and good shower and toilet. sweet deal price ( cheap as anything for sydney central!!!!) we drove and the parking lot was right next door!!! very good pricing for parking, hotel stamps your ticket and got a discount. highly recommended. the staff were lovely and had no problems at all, even stumbling at the wee hours of the morning and they were very nice :) lol

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: SlayerCopenhagen
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Capitol Square Hotel for three nights in april 2010. The room was nice and had all we could expect and needed. It was clean and had a good bed. The room had a small fridge, iron, hairdryer, a TV and A/C. The location is excellent. The hotel is close to the central station for trains, near the monorail and the lightrail is just around the corner. Many busses stop nearby on George st. The 555 free bus stops almost at the door. Nearest shopping is practically in the hotel, as there is a mall in the block. There is also plenty of shops and markets in the Heymarket/Chinatown area. The sights are easy to get to from this hotel, either by public transport or by foot. It took us only a little more than 30 minutes by foot to get to Circular Quay (City centre - Opera House and Harbour Bridge). We didn't try the hotel restaurant. There is a lot of nice restaurants andpubs nearby - do try a pie and a hot dog from Harry's Cafe de Wheels on Hay street (same block as the hotel). We got a really good deal on this hotel, as we booked a room for three nights and therefore got a 25% discount. I would stay at this hotel again should I be fortunate enough to visit Sydney again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location but an old girl with new makeup on”
Reviews.Author: TheRocksKiwi
Reviews.Content: This was a good little hotel. Got a really good deal via the Rydges.com website for 4 nights so was happy with the price especially since other hotels were charging more for one night than we paid for our whole stay. Nice location, close to Central train station and easy access to buses and the light rail. Lots of amenities & shops close by and right next door to Capitol Theatre so great if you are going to a show (we didnt however as we missed out on tickets). Good service from hotel staff, very friendly and helpful. The room was adequate enough, a bit small (we stayed in a twin which was located on the 2nd floor) but was enough for what we needed but certainly not like other Rydges hotels though. Note its not branded a Rydges hotel. Its basic but as I say provides what you need - a place to sleep. It's not really a place to spend your day in though, only for sleeping. Our only issue (other than the slight run down look) is that there's no sound proofing on the windows facing the street so you will be subjected to noise from the street (and a karaoke bar at 2am in the morning!). However this didnt affect us too greatly as we were too tired from our days out to worry. So if you're only wanting somewhere to sleep that is low cost then this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: travelmate4
Reviews.Content: The romm was extremely dirty and had a very bad smell making us leave the door open most of the time. The cleaner came and all they did was spray deoderiser around so then the room smelt like moth balls, mouldy carpet and also cheap overpowering deoderiser. Parking tarriffs were a joke even with the huge $2 discount. There was human feasis on the toilet roll holder and the toilet was filthy and bathroom mouldy. Reception could not care less and when the cleaner actually came he could not speak english and would just smile and spray deoderiser in the air saying "all good, all good". Well NO it was not all good. My stay at the Rydges was far from satisfactory for myself, wife and two young children. I will not be staying at another Rydges again and if anyone mentions to me that they are looking at staying in Sydney or anywhere alse for that matter I will not suggest Rydges. In fact I will advise people against Rydges. You need to clean your act up to raise standards. If you are targeting packpackers I think it would even be a stretch to get them to stay under the conditions I witnessed. Sad.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Getting Around”
Reviews.Author: tombeau
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is close to Central Station for Trains, George Street for Busses, and within walking distance to all the CBD attractions. The room was good size and the refrigerator was sufficient. Staff were freindly and efficient. We found it was an excellent base of operations for our 2 week stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Centrally Located Hotel”
Reviews.Author: prashantkataria
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay of 2 nights at this lovely hotel. staff was nice. Location wise its superb and not too expensive. clean and tidy with all basic amenities in the room like coffee/tea making, iron, tv, alarm, etc. Walking distance from Sydney Central (the Railway station) and just across the street from paddy market and china town. Darling harbour is a short walk and George Street, on which this place is located (just off George Street), goes all the way to Circular Quay from where u can take the ferries, go to The Rocks or the Opera House. Decent eating places close to the hotel including a lebanese/pizza/burger place serving nice sumptuous fare at reasonable price. shopping is good on george street as well. best thing is the location

Reviews.Title: “very satisfied”
Reviews.Author: CanberraWanderer74
Reviews.Content: Again I stayed in this Hotel and was completely satisfied as an overnight staying location. Close to transport and Darling Harbour, Markets, etc. We stayed 2 nights and was quite,comfortable and clean. The staff were friendly and breakfast voucher for $10 very acceptable. Complimentary newspaper included.

Reviews.Title: “Don't let the bed bugs bite!”
Reviews.Author: bonita_9Canberra
Reviews.Content: Although set in a pretty great location and just a walk from many shopping destinations and markets, the actual rooms are teeny and the traffic noise you can hear is extremely loud. In addition to this, I was bitten by some sort of bug one night there (I woke up with the bug biting me on the neck) which caused an allergic reaction with itchy red spots all over my body. I thought it was just me, but within a day of returning home from Sydney, my friends (who also stayed in the hotel) had rashes and hives all over them. It has been a week since then and the itchiness and redness hasn't gotten any better, doctors have basically said to wait it out til it gets better itself. Overall, an okay trip turned really horrible!

Reviews.Title: “Unhelpful staff and waste of money”
Reviews.Author: Lottie1981
Reviews.Content: We found the staff here to be very unhelpful and very unfriendly, particularly one guy, and hade to leave in the end to stay at Travelodge, where the rooms were spotless and much bigger, and the staff actually smiled at you when you walked in the door! We wonÂ´t be returning to Capitol.

Reviews.Title: “It's the people that make a place”
Reviews.Author: mbdnz
Reviews.Content: I have travelled a bit and if there is one thing I have learnt it is that it is generaly the people that make a place not the country itself. Hotels are similar. The Capitol Square Hotel was a comfortable and pleasant place to stay. Contrary to other reviews our room was extreemly quite despite the George St.location. It was serviced daily and was well located close to China Town and the markets. There is a very good food court right next door to the hotel. As I alluded to previously as much as the property met my expectations it was the staff and in particular the reception staff [especially 3 people, the young asian lady along with an eastern european guy who was studying tourism and the South African night clerk who's names I have forgotten but who's assistance will last much longer than most of my memories of Sydney] really made the stay all that more enjoyable

Reviews.Title: “was a good hotel to stay at”
Reviews.Author: Teckhamster
Reviews.Content: was a good hotel to stay at but the service could be better and staff are not very helpful and food was a long walk but close to darling harbour and china town good value but could be better for the price .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value Hotel - Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Jimmy68
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reading the reviews on this site. I did not have unrealistic expectations, unlike some other reviewers on this site. I found the hotel to be more than adequate for my stay. I was with a friend from the UK and all we really wanted was somewhere inexpensive, clean, and close to everything. The Capitol Square Hotel ticked all the right boxes. Interestingly, the (single) bed was one of the more comfortable ones I have slept on in hotels in recent years.

Reviews.Title: “This is a bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: Roamingx
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here before and it was "fine" -- tired decor but good enough service and a good location, clean enough, and things worked. This time, I was put into a room with broken Internet access and when I complained I was instructed to call a third-party call center in Manila who were hopeless. Wasted half an hour of time and caused me to miss an important work deadline. I was able to switch rooms to get working Internet, but the new room didn't even have a water glass in the bathroom! The first room had a large column that blocked access to the desk and no place to plug in a laptop anywhere near the desk so pretty unusable; in the second room, the desk is so close to the bed that there is not enough room to fit the chair in so you have to sit on the bed and reach out to the desk to use it. You need to insert the key into a box on the wall to turn on the power, which also turns on the Internet router, so if you want your computer on the Internet while you're out of the room forget about it. This hotel is not well planned, not well managed, and does not seem to care much about its facilities or how it treats its guests. As the most telling example, the front door to the hotel opens in one direction only and they don't even bother to put a "push" or "pull" sign on it. I'm quite surprised that Rydges would allow its name to be associated with this place.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location (Very near to all transport)”
Reviews.Author: zhangyin78
Reviews.Content: I stayed there on the night of 19 March 2009 becuase we need to catch a very early train next morning. It only takes about 5 mins walk to the station, 1 min to bus stop, 2 mins to monorail station. The hotel itself is OK, everying is very simple. Staying there for 1 night is ok, but not so confortable for long-term stay. I think it's suitable for self pay travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable but difficult for us to find”
Reviews.Author: Victorianlad
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last year and have only just remembered to write a review, so in fairness to the hotel I will not be too nit-picky as the months that have passed have probably dulled some of my memories of the stay. My mother remarked that overall she thought the hotel was reasonable value, though my distant memory is that it was a tad noisy. The room was acceptable and appeared to have been renovated within the last five years, if not more recently. The major thing that I recall about this hotel is that despite it being close to Central Railway Station (suburban, intrastate and interstate trains, the Pyrmont light rail and the Airport Link train), it was difficult to find. Of course the hotel is on the light rail route as it winds its way down from above Eddy Avenue at Central Station. I walked around the block for five minutes before finally finding its entrance. I have been to more than 30 countries and rarely have this difficulty when walking to a hotel, so perhaps he or she has not done so in the months since we stayed, the hotel's manager needs to obtain a permit from the City of Sydney and install a more easily locatable sign on the street. Other than that, this was an acceptable hotel at which we did not feel we were ripped off, although perhaps The Great Southern Hotel across the road offers slightly quieter surroundings and pips the Capitol Square for good value.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best and not a boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Durhamguy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Capitol Hotel as my last stop in Australia, loved Sydney but not this hotel. It is a basic three star and the fact that it is owned by Rydges is quite surprising. Definetly not a boutique hotel unless this is the ambition. Certainly the work and transformation had not started during my stay in July. First impression was not good the reception area has a sterile youth hostel feel about it. The girl on reception was okay but no Aussie welcome. During my stay I would say some staff here where polite and friendly while others had little motivation in their job. Stayed in room 514, which was compact and comfortbale but nothing special. Bathroom very small and quite tacky. Location wise no complaints, caught the train from the airport to Central Station which is about a 10 - 15 minute journey then its just a short walk to the hotel. Capitol Square is right next to the theatre of the same name with a small shopping centre, Starbucks and Irish pub in the same block. Directly next to China Town some of which isn't that picturesque, but Darling Harbour which is brilliant is only a 15 minute walk away. Circular Quay is easy to reach either by taking the train, or a ferry from Darling Harbour which is certainly the most fun way or a good walk down George Street. Never had breakfast in the hotel instead whent along to Darling Harbour and had great meals sitting in the sunshine in one of the numerous outdoor cafes. Next time in Sydney probably will stay in Darling Harbour.

Reviews.Title: “noisy”
Reviews.Author: tripp0ne
Reviews.Content: I requested a quiet room when booking. I was given a room where you could distinctly hear people in the adjacent rooms coughing or talking, which make me wake up at nightime. The room was tiny, but this would have been fine for the price I paid, if a better sound insulation had been provided. This is not what you expect from a hotel of this category. No information at all was provided about telephone and internet rates in the room. I came back one night and found the entrance shut with a sign saying "reception is temporarily closed", and I had to wait outside for a while before being allowed to get into my room.

Reviews.Title: “Compact”
Reviews.Author: ammefellow
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights when passing through Sydney on business, and a tight-ish budget. Got a good price through the Visitors' Centre. Most things about this hotel were just ok. The room I had could be described as 'compact' but no worse than in most major cities; room was clean. Bathroom pretty small (especially the bath - why bother? A shower would do in the space available). Breakfast adequate. I was on the second floor and was alarmed at the noise coming up from the restaurants next door when I exited the lift. I suspect the walls are pretty thin between rooms too, although luckily I didn't have noisy neighbours and the restaurant noise didn't actually stop me sleeping. I recommend the @Bangkok restaurant next door, incidentally - I think I was probably the only non-Thai person there, which is a pretty good indication of its quality. Two things annoyed me a lot. Firstly, the high internet charges. 50c a minute and I think your usage was capped at an hour in every 24 hours, though I didn't carry on using it too long at that price! There's also Secondly, the booklet in the room recommends guests make use of the safety deposit boxes at reception - well, they're tiny, far too small to get any valuable objects into unless they're paper and can be folded.

Reviews.Title: “Good for those on a budget”
Reviews.Author: ausstayer
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews for this hotel I was a little put off, however, staying in a standard twin, we booked this fairly last minute and for somewhere that was fairly close (approx 15 mins walking distance) to Darling Harbour and approx 20 mins monorail and walk to the Quay, the hotel was a decent price. It is basically in Chinatown, very close to Paddy's market and I would recommend using the monorail (get a day pass) to get around Sydney because the Paddy's market station is close and Sydney trains are pretty expensive. The rooms although quite small were adequate, sheets were clean, although the bed covers really probably need to be replaced. Staff were friendly and I would recommend this hotel for those wanting somewhere to stay close to the city on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: AnnG62
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel as we were off to Sydney to see "Billy Elliot". The theatre is right next door, fantastic location! Very busy check in but staff delightful and helpful. There were seven of us and as we had arrived early only one room was ready, the other rooms were ready within 30 minute's of us arriving, so just great. Rooms are small~ish but adequate, very clean. We had three beds in our room and three chairs, bedside tables and lamps and bathroom while small was cetainly big enough, as previously suggested, to do what you need to do in a bathroom. A cupboard to hang clothes in and an ironing board! Small fridge and tea and coffee facilities. Oh and a TV. What amazed me was that we had a room facing Paddy's Market and thought that the traffic may have kept us awake at night! Hardly heard it at all! For us this hotel was very quiet. Breakfast was very good for the price and service of the young man who was clearing our table contantly was wonderful, l'm sorry l did not get his name, but he was terrific. Location of this hotel is wonderful, as mentioned a one minute walk if that to capitol Theatre, 10 minutes to Darling Harbour, across the road to Paddy's Market, 5 minutes to China Town, and a short bus ride to Circular Quay. Some very handy palces to eat close by. Yes, l would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: CookFamilyfromCanada
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the first stay in Australia on my honeymoon. When we checked in it was rather frustrating that we had to go down to the basement, then go up a dirty elevator to get to our room. However, main elevator was fixed within a few hours of our stay. Staff was friendly for the most part, however, at times front desk could have used another person working as it did get really busy. Asked if they had any special deals for honeymoon couple and the lady at the desk said she could not help us to talk to management. It would have been nice if she could have took it upon herself to ask management. Room was nice for the most part. However, did get a little noisy at night. Our Queen sized bed was also two single beds pushed together. Hotel did have internet in 2nd floor lobby which was nice being from Canada and all. The location was great as all the other reviews have said. I think location is by far the best part about the trip as we were out of the room more then in it. The only real bad thing I have to say about this hotel is that we were told if we used a phone card it would only cost $.50 a cal at the most and we made about ten shorter calls and had $40.00 worth of charges. I would stay there again for the price!!

Reviews.Title: “Move Out”
Reviews.Author: noosasunshine
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on rydges web site, Billy Elliot at the Capital hotel next door. The room was very small with 2 single beds bathroom, room for one person only at a time, window faced on to a alley ,dark room very tired hotel expected more from the Rydges Group. If you want to go to see a show at the Capital ,try the Metro opposite.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for less money”
Reviews.Author: ponos
Reviews.Content: Stay for 8 days,on christmas and new year.Room was smal but clean and only on the hottest day ( 42 C ) the aircondicion did't work very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, pity about everything else”
Reviews.Author: busytraveller085
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many different Sydney hotels and this time around I searched for a well located hotel within Sydney for a reasonable rate for a one night stay just before Christmas. With a rate of $99 for a Sunday night stay in Sydney, Capitol Square Hotel appeared to fit the bill for this, so I was happy to book through the Rydges.com website. Upon my arrival at the hotel late on the Sunday evening, the reception was attended by two staff members, one of whom was on the phone, the other simply looked up at me blankly and said "check in with what name?" I mean come on, it takes only a few seconds more to actually say hello and actually get to know your guest, so I was rightly annoyed at this lack of courtesy. The same staff member then thrust a registration card at me and simply said "can i have your credit card so I can take an imprint". Why bother employing staff when they do not actually bother to get to know their guests? I was allocated a room on the 5th floor of the hotel, and told by the staff member that this was "the good floor to be on", well if this was the good floor I would really hate to see the other ones! The room had splotchy marks all over the carpets, dented old furniture and to make things even worse the bathroom was literally the size of a closet and did not have any towels at all! So I had to call back downstairs to reception to ask for some towels to be sent up to my room. I called twice and on both occasions the number simply rang out, on the third attempt my request was finally answered by a staff member who treated my call with contempt and merely stated that they would "bring them up when they got a moment", I mean I am a paying guest, surely my concerns are a priority. Checking out early on Monday morning was certainly very fast, I arrived at the reception desk and said that I was checking out, the staff member merely said back to me "what room" and then proceeded to check me out without even a moments pause. My request to speak to someone about my stay merely yielded a response of "the manager will not be here until 9am and I can't help you", I have stayed at many different hotels in Sydney and elsewhere, and this is the first time that I have actually been told that my opinion is worthless. This hotel has a great location at the heart of the entertainment district with Darling Harbour nearby. However the service here is simply appalling and definately not up to the standards of a Rydges property. Throughout my stay I gained the impression that I was simply not important enough to be listened to, and that the staff simply do not care as long as you pay up and get out in time. Next time I am in Sydney and paying for my own accommodation I will definately be staying at Ibis World Square or Metro on Pitt, who I am sure will actually appreciate and enjoy having me as a guest.

Reviews.Title: “Unprofessional and disorganised!”
Reviews.Author: niki_mouse
Reviews.Content: My friend and I were only in Sydney for one night to go to a concert, so we were happy to stay in a budget hotel in a busy area. The place wasnâ€™t too noisy, and the location is fantastic, a short 5 minute walk to central station and heaps of shops, restaurants etc. The bathroom and room were clean, apart from the doona cover which had urine stains and the carpet which had a large orange stain (not that the carpet matters). However, it was the poor service we received when we arrived that turned us off. I was called the day before the booking and informed that there was an error with wotif.com; the website kept taking bookings even though they were full, so they were now overbooked. The lady was very nice, and explained that theyâ€™d arranged accommodation for us across the road at the Metro, which has the same star-rating and amenities and would be the same price. For the inconvenience, Capitol would throw in a complimentary breakfast, too. We arrived at the Metro and waited in line a while, and when we got to the desk the staff couldnâ€™t find our booking. About ten minutes was spent waiting in line and then waiting for the staff to go through the system to find us, checking with other staff, etc. Then we were told they needed to call the Capitol, because they couldnâ€™t find our booking. I wasnâ€™t too happy about all the waiting as we had a tight turnaround time before we had to leave for our concert, and we were hoping to get a nanna nap in before we left. We waited another ten minutes while the Metro staff tried for a while to get through to the Captitol (either the phone was busy or no-one was answering) but we were finally told that the Capitol DID have a room for us. Now thatâ€™s inconvenience: waiting in line when youâ€™re tired, hungry and thirsty for no reason whatsoever. We got to Capitol and waited in line some more. We overheard the clerk say to the customers in front of us as they left for their room, that they were in the â€œgoodâ€� side of the hotel, meaning away from the street and the roadworks. How unprofessional to say that at all -admitting that thereâ€™s a good and bad side to a hotel when you pay the same rate- and worse, in front of other customers!? We were given our room key and I asked if breakfast was still included; in my opinion weâ€™d been stuffed around more waiting across the road unnecessarily than we would have been if weâ€™d actually checked in to the Metro. The clerk checked our paperwork and said that our booking didnâ€™t include it. I explained that weâ€™d been told we were now getting complimentary breakfast, to which the manager told the clerk right in front of us (we werenâ€™t important enough to be acknowledged) that no, our booking didnâ€™t come with breakfast, and we werenâ€™t supposed to go to the Metro at all (as if it was our fault we went there). We were told to go to the Metro by Capitol, but they wouldnâ€™t admit their mistake nor make good on their conciliation for the hassle. Annoyed, I pointed out that theyâ€™d wasted our time, about half an hour (meaning no nap). Indirectly, the clerk then accused us of lying, by checking his watch and saying itâ€™d only been ten minutes since he received the phone call from the Metro. Again, they didnâ€™t seem to grasp the fact that it was their fault we were waiting 20 minutes at the Metro, not the Metros or ours. The Capitolâ€™s handling of the issue made us feel completely undervalued; a free breakfast is nothing compared to the loss of repeat business from people who stay in Sydney CBD regularly. So there you have it: location good; amenities okay; service appalling.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: LABruin
Reviews.Content: Don't agree w/ other reviewer. In fact, our floor was being painted during our stay (rooms & halls). Only heard street noise if window was left open. As it's the end of autumn, beginning of winter didn't even try the A/C. Never tried the dining room as I agree $10 is a bit much for breakfast when all I need is a piece of fruit or a muffin. Central Station was about as far as Darling Harbour, a 10-15 minute walk. We even walked up George St. to Queen Elizabeth Mall so it's really conveniently located. 2 blocks from Paddy's Market, banks everywhere, & a Starbucks right next door. Many Asian restaurants in the area as you're in Chinatown. Found a laundrymat between the hotel & Central Stn. I'd say better than the YHA 2 blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Hostel type accomodation”
Reviews.Author: nzfligher
Reviews.Content: My parents and I stayed in the family room for 4 nights in June 07. Upon arrival we were asked to deposit $50 for 10 days which we weren't aware of (we booked throu Expedia.com.au and no such info was available). The room was small which we didnt mind. The floor boards throughout the room made noise everytime you walked. The bed cover was faded ad had many stains and a few holes. The beds are certainly not comfortable. One major issue we had was the Air Conditioning unit in the room was blowing cold air in the middle of the night. Breakfast is quite simple and not worth $10. One thing that we were quite annoyed about was the fact that the hotel is dirty by anyone's standard. The towels are well used and in need of replacement. In my opinion the hotel is not a 3 star hotel. The hotel has vending machines for alcohol, bevereges,snacks, toothbrushes, etc... so you cannot really say that this is a hotel, it had a hostel feel to it. I was aware that the hotel went through a soft refurbishing but I think soft refurbishing meant that they changed the carpet only. Location is not very good, it takes over 10 mins to walk to central station or the Town Hall station. The hotel is not too far to Darling Harbour which seems to be the only positive side of the hotel. Being on a main street, it is very noisy at nights, there is a bar/pub downstairs which adds to the street noise! There are also restaurants on the other side of the hotel and you can definitely hear the noise when you are n the hallways. I suggest to shop around for a hotel in sydney, this hotel is too expensive for $95-$115 a night for 2, mainly because it is a run down hotel, uncomfortable and lacks the wow factor. Hotels around the Central Station are cheaper and in better condition, although it feels that they are not really in town but are only seconds from the central station which means that for a day ticket you can go pretty much every where in town faster and with less walking.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel within easy reach of Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: JoFromBracknell
Reviews.Content: Good hotel for a base within walking distance of Chinatown and Darling Harbour. Just off a busy road but no real problem with noise and within easy reach of bus routes to the Opera House, shops and Bondi. The room (Queen) was not exactly spacious but had a balcony and aircon; the bathroom was really very tiny but serviceable. Buffet style breakfast was more than adequate, and the guy on the Reception Desk was very helpful. Quite OK for a couple of nights stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly fine”
Reviews.Author: A_Traveller27
Reviews.Content: Paid 45 GBP per night, stayed for 4 nights. Hotel was perfectly fine, bed was soft and comfortable, didn't get any noise problems. Room and bathroom were clean - not at all kennel-sized. Had room for two large suitcases. Reception staff were really friendly and helpful - told us how to get to places and gave us internet sites for long term accomodation. Had buffet breakfast for $10 each, was very nice. Location is excellent - walking distance to chinatown, Darling Harbour, central station and CBD. I don't remember an Irish pub being downstairs but it's a large hotel so it may depend where your room is. All in all a perfectly fine stay - good value, great location. Obviously not the Ritz though!

Reviews.Title: “DREADFUL”
Reviews.Author: mdgalore
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel based on another website's reviews. Whilst it is close to Chinatown and next door to the Captitol Theatre, it has small (dog kennel sized) rooms, hard beds (I mean worn out not firm), cleaning standard is less than that of a backpackers. We stayed in Backpackers which have been better. I have stayed in may hotels in Sydney and have had better experiences at a cheaper price. This hotel should be more around the $60 per night mark. Oh, if you like noise and thin walls, this is the place for you with an Irish pub right underneath going on Friday to the wee hours of the morning. Sydney does love to show off the sirens the Government has paid for on the Police and Fire vehicles and these pass right up George street every hour at least. The Rydges in Camperdown, an old hotel near the Hospital, is MUCH better.

Reviews.Title: “Ok at the best”
Reviews.Author: get_jessica
Reviews.Content: We booked accomodation at the new Meriton apartments in sydney for the week but they could not accomodate us for the first night of our trip so we stayed at the capitol square whilst awaiting our other accomodation. We paid $120 for the night which was quite cheap and the room was ok. It was small but quite clean and had a tiny balcony that you could stand on to smoke. The bed was quite comfortable and checkin and checkout was fast and easy and the staff even offered to keep our baggage there the next morning until we could check in at our other apartment. The cleaning staff were even friendlier than the reception staff greeting you with a 'hello ..how are you' every time you bumped into them in the hallways, a nice gesture i thought. All in all it did the job and for the price you cant complain. I wouldnt recommend lond stays in the hotel though as the room would be too small and the area (chinatown) isnt as nice as the city or the harbour, it was quite convient though for its central location.

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BanaPona
Reviews.Content: I had an extended stay at this hotel, as I was in Sydney for 6 days of business and several more for pleasure. I stayed at this hotel as a conference-recommended hotel and it seems like a fine choice for a budget traveler. In response to one of the previous reviews, yes the TV seems to be reception-only (no cable or sat TV) but there were a number of stations and as a US-expat living in Asia I enjoyed watching Letterman and USA morning shows at the wee hours of the morning â€“ so the reception and channels were fine enough. The location is pretty good â€“ you can easily walk to places like Darling Harbour and Hyde Park (both about 15 mins walk away). There were many and frequent buses right out at the street that take you directly down to Circular Quay (5 min bus ride). There are a ton of restaurants in the area â€“ especially if you crave Asian food (there are plenty of non-Asian choices also). There is a major grocery store 2 blocks away â€“ and keeping yourself well-stocked was no problem and very convenient. I was not a fan of the breakfast â€“ the choice is somewhat limited. Although the setting is bright and cool, I only ate breakfast there as it was a convenience on working days. The young staff was very friendly and helpful â€“ and after so many days I had a lot of contact with them. One downside was that some guests seemed to attempt smoking in their rooms (which is not allowed) and set off the fire alarm - - this happen at least twice and having to evacuate is not a pleasant experience. Overall, it was a pleasant stay. While initially I was not sure I could stay for so long in a small room, it grew on me and I quickly grew to like it.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but not sure I'd stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Heckle
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on line and asked for a non smoking room. Upon entering the room it was evident that it was a smoking room - there was an ashtray sitting on the TV ! My husband went down to reception and complained about the smell - we were quickly moved to a larger non smoking room. Bathrooms are very small and there was no water pressure in the shower. Breakfast was okay..The reception area is very small and looks like it needs a revamp and not very impressive and if there are lots of people checking in it gets very cramped. I have stayed at better hotels nearby for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location, slightly above average hotel”
Reviews.Author: beachbunn-e
Reviews.Content: I booked Capitol Square due to it's price and location. I wanted a basic but clean hotel right in the city. That is exactly what I got - not much more. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The lady at reception gave me great ideas on where to site-see, and how to get around. The room was small, but nicely decorated. Didn't try the food, but I checked out the breakfast buffet and it looked good. The only negative is the cleaning - my room appeared to be cleaned thoroughly when I arrived, but I went to have a bath and noticed long dark hairs in the tub!! Yuck. However, in spite of the cleaning misfortune, I would recommend this hotel if you are looking for a hotel with no frills, inexpensive, and centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “A superior pension”
Reviews.Author: wingate
Reviews.Content: This was a hotel that i was booked into as part of a group.I would not choose to stay here.There is a reception area only on the ground with just one lift to serve the whole building.There is a breakfast room on the second floor where you can get a very reasonable breakfast for $10.The room was too small.There was not enough storage space for both of us so i had to keep my clothes in my case.In the bathroom the mirror is inadequately lit so i could not see adequately when i shaved.Its main virtue is that it is very centrally located,being just off George Street

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - furniture a bit tired”
Reviews.Author: Jim100Uk
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in mid February and one night in March (liked it enought to return!). Hotel well located close to Chinatown (great food)and the pleasant pedestrianised walkways to Darling Harbour (fantastic evening venue). Short walk to City Monorail and around 20 minutes along Pitt Street (the main shopping street)to Circle Quays Harbour and Opera House. Supermarket/ travel companies and internet cafes all around. As already reported reception is tiny but there was a locked room to store lugage. Staff helpful and friendly. Rooms compact with furniture looking a bit tired but nonetheless clean. I found the hotel to be suprisingly quiet expecially considering its location close to George Street/Pitt Street and I am a very light sleeper. An interesting Restaurant with a good breakfast choice. Overall I reckon this hotel was very good value for money and would certainly use again.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this Terrible Hotel !!!”
Reviews.Author: Traveller2006
Reviews.Content: Me and a friend had the misfortune of staying at this hotel. The location is rubbish - there is nothing of interest nearby. There is only ONE lift for the entire hotel to use which is utterly ridiculous. The receptionist is extremely rude - he doesn't even bother to say hello when you greet him. When you walk into the hotel the first thing you see is tons of luggage lying around as there is no storage room. Anyone can walk off with somebody else's suitcase. The rooms was VERY small - the floorboards creak and the reception on the TV was appalling - unwatchable. The beds are uncomfortable. The hotel was FREEZING - we had to wrap up before going to have breakfast in the mornings. If you want to check in early or check out late - FORGET IT - They charge you astronomical rates!! Complete rip-off. The walls are thin and you hear the people staying in the room next door. Even the breakfast was mediocre. This is one of the worst hotels I have ever stayed at. I would not stay there again if they paid me. Avoid at all costs. You have been warned.

HotelInfo.Name: Capitol Square Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Corner Campbell and George Streets | PO Box K1290, Haymarket, Sydney, New South Wales 1240, Australia
